item.description:
This event is being led by Larry F.

Mt. Monadnock is the most climbed mountain in the world (sorry, Mt. Fuji, you’re #2). Join Sitz as we climb this famous mountain not far from Boston. We will take the White Dot trail from the Visitor Center (1400′), take the Cascade Link to the Red Spot Trail and take it to the top (3,200′). Descent will be up to the group. On a clear day, you can just see the Boston skyline 70 miles away.

THIS IS A STRENUOUS CLIMB, WE WILL BE GOING 1,800 UP AND 1,800 FEET DOWN AND WILL NOT BE ABLE TO WAIT FOR STRAGGLERS. Proper footwear and attire are a must (contact Larry “before” with any questions about difficulty, clothing or supplies, etc.).

Bring a lunch to eat at the top and snacks. Bring, at least 2 L water. After, we will head to Kimball\’s Ice cream for a well earned treat. Plan to meet at the A-Loft/Elements parking lot at Exit 30 West off Route 128/95 where we will carpool from. Carpool leaves at 8:00 sharp so we can start the hike by 10:00. Rain cancels.

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO:

Hold harmless, and indemnify the organizers and their relations and heirs, and all members and participants of the Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment. As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. This is not a guided tour.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at Visitor Center, Larry's cell 781.721.7484
item.name: Mt. Monadnock hike...for fit climbers only
